text: this dusty mountain trail is now the
only safe entrance into tears these
steep bridges cut through front lines
that surround the city a journey into
the city that used to take minutes now
takes hours vital supplies fuel food and
livestock are all transported up these
paths into an increasingly desperate
City after a long trek we finally make
it in besieged for months much of the
city is now in ruins these fighters come
under regular attack from rebel Houthi
militia that surround Thais entire
districts face the threat of snipers
this family comes under fire as they try
to escape
we are given access to the city's only
emergency hospital doctors here face
tough choices without basic medical
supplies they have to ration operations
[Music]
Osama is lucky enough to be treated but
unfortunately for him without any
general anesthetic in another room we
find six-year-old Ozma Hameed's alone in
her bed she was hit during a mortar
attack by healthy rebels as the children
of her village gathered to collect water
around killed five of them and injured
another 19 the doctor tells me she's all
alone she has no family at the hospital
[Music]
Asma died a few weeks later
entire homes here have been destroyed
yet many refuse to leave
Abdullah and his family live on what
used to be a frontline he says he has no
other options but to stay we're afraid
but we have nowhere else to go no water
no electricity nothing wherever we go
we'll suffer at least he will have
dignity he invites me in to see the
damage to his home Abdullah tells me the
children have become used to the sound
of war outside the city saudi-led
coalition forces continue to pound
healthy positions a ceasefire in Yemen
has come and gone in this complex war
it's become increasingly clear that
neither side can win safar al Ahmed BBC
News Taz
